I get skeptical when I hear the word "informant." The feds have, and this is a matter of public record, not tinfoil hat talk, sought out individuals whom they believed COULD BE radicalized, though they were currently not, for the purpose of radicalizing them. They profile people to find out who CAN BE radicalized, then they send these "informants" out to befriend them and talk to them and lead them down certain paths of logic that will over time lead them to radicalization. THEN ... when they finally plan an attack ... and attack that NEVER would have happened had the federal government NOT radicalized them, the informant tells his boss "time to save America!"

Then the feds swoop in and say "You see! You need us! Imagine how many would have been killed had we not saved you! Not only do you need us, but you need to hand over your rights as well because obviously you can't be trusted with them."
